column1: Yesterday was a very long day, said Vrouw Vedder on the morning after Market Day. "You were gone such a long time."Kat gave her mother a great hug."We'll stay with you all day today
column5: said Kit; and he hugged her too.And we'll help you just as much as we helped Father yesterday. Won't we
column7: said Kit.I shouldn't wonder!" said Father."I shall be glad of help
column8: said Vrouw Vedder, because Grandma is coming
column9: and I want everything to be very clean and tidy when she comes. I'm going first to the pasture to milk the cow. You can go with me and keep the flies away. That will be a great help."Vrouw Vedder put a yoke across her shoulders
column10: with hooks hanging from each end of it. Then she hung a large pail on one of the hooks
column11: and a brass milk can on the other. She gave Kat a little pail to carry
column12: and Kit took some switches from the willow tree in the yard
column13: with which to drive away the flies. Then they all three started down the road to the pasture.
